definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation

sentences.english: We must now set about solving this problem, because the demands from the minority nationalities are pressing.
sentences.chinese: 但是现在必须开步走，因为少数民族的要求是迫切的。
忽然间神父又开步走了。

sentences.english: She stood there rooted to the spot when she saw the body.
sentences.chinese: 她看见那具尸体后吓得迈不开步，呆立在那里。

sentences.english: For the benefit of economic development, we have to get started right now.
sentences.chinese: 从经济上看，现在不开步走也不行了。

sentences.english: Even though we have yet to resolve many differences of views on this question, we should start to move on it right now.
sentences.chinese: 经济协作有许多思想问题要统一，但现在要开步走。

definition: to sway one's hips/to twist one's waist
T-step (basic dance position, with the feet forming a T shape)
to bow/to bend at the waist
to stop/to halt/halt!/to hold resolutely (of a view, an aspiration etc)
